alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Barry; Clinton; Eaton; Gratiot; Ingham; Ionia; Kent; Montcalm; Muskegon; Newaygo; Ottawa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 12 at 11:59AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids has issued a * Flood Watch for portions of central Michigan, south central Michigan, southwest Michigan, and west central Michigan, including the following areas, in central Michigan, Gratiot and Montcalm. In south central Michigan, Clinton, Eaton, Ingham, and Ionia. In southwest Michigan, Allegan, Barry, Kent, and Ottawa. In west central Michigan, Muskegon and Newaygo. * Through late tonight * Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall will move into the region later this afternoon and into tonight. Repeated rounds of thunderstorms are possible over the same areas over the course of several hours. Storm total rainfall amounts of 2"-4" are expected with some localized amounts to 5" possible. Urban centers and areas that have experienced significant rainfall over the last couple of weeks will be prone to flooding of roads, fields, and low lying areas. Flooded roadways will be a particular concern after sunset and will be a hazard to nighttime driving.
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible flood warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Weather Preparedness Information is available on line at www.ready.gov/floods.

area.areaDesc: Allegan; Barry; Clinton; Eaton; Gratiot; Ingham; Ionia; Kent; Montcalm; Muskegon; Newaygo; Ottawa
